results.title: The Seventh seal
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman’s “Seventh seal” deserves its reputation as a benchmark in the lexicon of modern cinema. With striking imagery, captivating characters and deep philosophical arguments Bergman weaves a rich tapestry as only a master can. Set in the middle ages in the midst of the plague, Antonius Block (Max Von Sydow) is a knight returning from the crusades. When Death (Bengt Ekerot) appears before him he suggests a game of chess to forestall his fate. He travels to his home with an assortment of characters, including his atheist squire Jons (Gunnar Bjornstrand) and a troupe of travelling players. Despite it’s metaphysical content “The Seventh Seal” also includes a heavy dose of Scandinavian humour. In Swedish with english subtitles.

results.title: Long live the lady! = Lunga vita alla signora!
results.creator_credit: Ermanno Olmi, Giampietro Bonamigo, Artificial Eye, Cinemaundici and RAIUNO
results.brief_description: Ermanno Olmi’s “Lunga Vita alla signora!” will be a delightful film for anyone working in the hospitality industry. Six young hospitality trainees are chosen to assist with a banquet in honour of a mysterious old lady. The great day does not unfold as they expected. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1987 Venice Film Festival. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: A Dog of Flanders
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz, Associated producers, DeLuxe Cinemascope and TCF
results.brief_description: 12 year old Nello lives with his grandfather near Antwerp. They manage to eke a living by delivering milk into the city. Nello dreams of becoming a famous artist like Ruebens and is able to satisfy his interest by befriending a painter. One day while returning from a delivery Nello discovers a dog, left for dead in the bushes. They take him home and restore his health. The owner soon turns up to reclaim his dog, fortunately he is unsuccessful. This is only the start to Nello’s troubles as his grandfather dies, leaving Nello without enough money to look after himself, let alone the dog. A touching story that will appeal to the whole family. Starring David Ladd, Donald Crisp and Theodore Bikel. Based on the novel by Ouida.

results.title: Horses
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basics to Eventing”.
Horse riding and good horsemanship in three parts. Pt. 1: “The Ten Commandments” gives an introduction to the basics of good riding. Pt. 2: “Learning to Jump” shows the way in which horses and riders are trained for jumping in the South Australian Police Force Mounted Division. Pt. 3: “The Cross-Country Event” focuses on differing aspects of horsemanship from handling to competition.

results.title: Michael Collins
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Redmond Morris, Stephen Woolley and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: Ireland 1916, His dreams inspired hope, his words ignited passion and his courage forged a nation’s destiny. “Michael Collins” (Liam Neeson) is the story of a real-life patriot whose bravery and unswerving dedication to the Irish people changed history as it made him into a legend. Collins quest would bring a man raised on war into an even more dangerous battle for peace. It would cost him his life and make him a hero for the ages. This film encompasses romance, violence, valour, rage, burning hope and fiery tragedy. The performances given by Liam Neeson, Alan Rickman, Stephen Rea, Julia Roberts, Aidan Quinn and Charles Dance are superb and linger long after the movie finishes.

results.title: Tubby the tuba
results.brief_description: Tubby the Tuba, jealous of the beautiful melodies his fellow orchestra members create embarks on an adventure to find a melody of his own. On his travels he looks after a group of dancing elephants and together they travel to Singing City, the home of orphan tunes. Will Tubby find the melody he’s looking for? Based on the story by Paul Tripp, the songs, fun and friendship of Tubby’s adventures will delight children of all ages.

results.title: Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Peter Kosminsky, Mary Selway and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This colorful adaptation of Emily Bronte’s timeless novel follows the structure of the original story. Cathy and Heathcliff are childhood sweathearts whose love in adulthood is thwarted by the social conditions and expectations surrounding them. Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche are beautiful to watch although they don’t catch the intensity of the doomed lovers of Wuthering Heights. The Yorkshire moors make a picturesque backdrop and Ryuichi Sakamoto supplies beautiful music.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Richard Brennan, Timothy White, Meridian Films and Smiley Films
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!

results.title: The Secret of Roan Inish
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Sarah Green and Peter Newman Productions
results.brief_description: The Coneelly family, now living on the isolated west coast of Ireland, has been displaced from Roan Inish, the small, mysterious island which they shared with herds of seals. Fiona is sent to live there with her grandparents and becomes determined to penetrate the secrets of her family’s mysterious past and the legends they all embrace. Cast includes Mick Lally, Eileen Colgan, John Lynch and Jeni Courtney.
